name: places/ChIJAQAAAIVYwokRgjSEms1j39E
formattedAddress: 222 W 77th St, New York, NY 10024, USA
adrFormatAddress: 222 W 77th St, New York, NY 10024, USA

editorialSummary.text: Contemporary rooms in a fashionable lodging with a 1920s-inspired bar & an Italian eatery.

originalText.text:
This place has a great location, but be prepared to be charged an extra $75-$100 per night. We stayed for 3 days and inherited an extra $250 bill at the end.

The front desk clerk asked us if we wanted to upgrade our room just for an extra $15 per night. We should have said no. That extra $45 turned into a $250 bill. The biggest line item on the bill is some ambiguous “urban fee.”

When you try to call and get an explanation into the billing, it forwards you to a voicemail that is full. No explanation, just a bill with a bunch of extra charges no one agreed to.

Stay somewhere more transparent. That being said, cocktails were great and the service was fine. We had no complaints until receiving the bill.

originalText.text: GREAT location and AMAZING staff. My wife and I did a little staycation here. From the moment we walked in to the hotel everyone was so friendly. The team was very attentive in all areas and made sure to ask the right questions. Check in was quick and efficient and the staff went out of there way to ask if we had everything we needed. Really personable staff that remembered our names and even took the time to recommend things like the Stand up Comedy near by. This was a major plus for us. The rooms are also super clean and somewhat spacious with all the essentials you need. The beds are super comfortable. We will definitely be back again soon.

originalText.text: This place is a gem, a true home away from home. The service is genuinely friendly and supportive from the cleaners to reception, all  warm and engaged. They have a funky bar with live music and a separate room in the lobby that feels like your living room. After two weeks here I can say there were no downsides

They have a funky bar with live music and a separate room in the lobby that feels like your living room. After two weeks here I can say there were no downsides

originalText.text: Excellent stay as always.  We have stayed here many years. The long term staff are so helpful and friendly.  The beds are very comfortable. Rooms are clean with ample space.  The showers are big with great water pressure! Love it . Restaurant/ bar in lobby , great space. Thank you Arthouse, see you next year!!

text.text: Excellent stay as always.  We have stayed here many years. The long term staff are so helpful and friendly.  The beds are very comfortable. Rooms are clean with ample space.  The showers are big with great water pressure! Love it . Restaurant/ bar in lobby , great space. Thank you Arthouse, see you next year!!

originalText.text:
The hotel is a lovely venue on the Upper West Side of NY.  The staff are all very helpful and accommodating.  Requests are handled quickly.
The rooms are a bit small, but efficiently laid out with plenty of storage space.  The bathroom was also small, but also had adequate storage space and was efficiently designed.
There are many restaurants nearby as well as entertainment venues.  Lincoln Center is close by as are Central Park and the subway.
There is a coffee shop on the first floor that has wonderful lattes and amazing croissants.
I would definitely stay there again.
